subject: Creativity
title: Design for Space: Innovating Beyond Earth
description: A 60-second lesson on Design for Space: Innovating Beyond Earth.

hook.text: How do you design a toilet for zero gravity? A kitchen for Mars? A habitat for a 7-month journey?

buildup.text: Every object on the ISS was redesigned for microgravity â€” utensils, toilets, exercise equipment, sleeping bags.

discovery.text: NASA's design constraints are extreme: weight limits (every gram costs $10,000 to launch), zero waste, and more.

twist.text: SpaceX's Starship interior will need to house 100 people for months.

climax.text: Space design innovations return to Earth: memory foam, water purification systems, scratch-resistant lenses, and more.

punchline.text: Designing for space teaches us to design better for Earth.

quiz.question: How much does it cost to launch one gram of material to space?
